channel.title: Personal on Aggregated Thinking
channel.description: Recent content in Personal on Aggregated Thinking

item.title: Moving Forward
item.description: In a month’s time, I would be transferring offices again. I started from a very technical department, under the administration cluster.

item.title: Christmas 2013
item.description: We decided to go to Cebu and spend Christmas this year with my parents and brother. I suppose it has been more than 15 years since we last celebrated Christmas together.

item.title: Late upload. And no, I wasn't able to have a picture taken with Cardinal Tagle. :p

item.title: Valentine Surprise
item.description: Awww. How sweet of the wifey! Connie - Feb 5, 2013Awww. How sweet of the wifey! Amazing Story Sir Jon, you are so blessed :)

item.title: Valentine Surprise
item.description: Each year, on Valentine’s day, I usually surprise my darling wife with a letter/card, or a bouquet of roses. As it was a yearly thing, I knew she sort of expected these surprises; she’d look surprised, but I knew she wasn’t really.

item.title: on SLMIS
item.description: End users complain because the system isn’t “user-friendly”. FYI, it’s meant to be that way. It’s the only way we can guarantee that the system will still be helpful 25 years from now.

item.title: Migs in the Office!
item.description: I know about Thor’s hammer, but who or what is… E.J. - Jan 0, 2013I know about Thor’s hammer, but who or what is the Mjolnir you’re referring to?

item.title: Migs in the Office!
item.description: Miguel got real bored at home and wanted to go and meet his classmates. Since school doesn’t start until the 7th, I decided to take him with me to the office.

item.title: Civic Stories - December 2012
item.description: I sort of miss being in the backseat. A lot of my goofing off years have been conducted within the confines of the passenger doors, backside of the front seats, and the backseat.

item.title: Revisited: Blog changes, etc.
item.description: http://jon.doblados.net/2012/11/revisited-blog-cha... Jon Janairo Doblados - Nov 3, 2012http://jon.doblados.net/2012/11/revisited-blog-changes-etc/

item.title: Revisited: Blog changes, etc.
item.description: I’ve once more moved my blog. This time, it’s on my own hosting account and it’s back to using WP. Same blog, different flavor now and moving forward.

item.title: Honor God, Make Disciples
item.description: A couple of months ago, I started attending this workshop/training for leaders at Victory CDO. It’s called Training for Victory (T4V), and it was a once-a-week engagement for about 10 weeks; although it took longer than that because of several holidays around that time.

item.title: Kids on Photobooth
item.description: Miguel and Isabel goofing off in front of the laptop. They discovered the 4-shot option and started taking pictures by themselves.

item.title: Thank you!
item.description: You’re welcome, Jon. Having suffered form DHF… Joseph Somera - Jun 3, 2012You’re welcome, Jon. Having suffered form DHF myself, I know the hardships and trials that come with it.

item.title: Thank you!
item.description: I am home, and enjoying my second lease in life, one slow day at a time. I have never been hospitalized for something as life-threatening as DHF with complications before, so it’s a bit frustrating that even when I’m already out of the hospital, I could not move around as much as I want.

item.title: Miguel, lately.
item.description: Since we moved apartments, the little man started doing facial expressions that always gets us wondering how he got them. I’ve tried capturing these expressions with a camera but it’s a lot harder than simply having the phone or the point-and-shoot handy at all times.

item.description: A simple celebration and dinner at home. Mae did all of the cooking, except for the humba and paklay, courtesy of Dad.

item.title: Japanese Cake
item.description: More of the sweet stuff that we’re not supposed to be eating. Ok, it’s just me who’s restricted from eating this (and Mom), but it’s a rare treat from Dad’s good friend Ted Tanaka so I had a little morsel.

item.title: Musuan Trip
item.description: We went to Musuan, in Bukidnon. It’s home to the “boob” mountain, hence the name “Musuan”. Our dear Aunt Celia passed on and relatives from all over convened in CMU (where she was administrator).

item.description: We love Dimsum Diner, but we gotta start learning to keep ourselves from eating there too often. Why? We’re all high risk people, that’s why.

item.title: Stop Jejemon Bashing
item.description: It’s not my business, but I’m really tired of all of these jejemon-bashing stuff I’m seeing in twitter and facebook. Why not make an effort to educate these language-challenged people?

item.title: Fever and what-not's
item.description: I dare not say what we hope our daughter didn’t get that’s causing her on and off high fever since Tuesday night.

item.title: ang pinoy at ang Starbucks. Latte Loco? ERR. (source: teentalk)
item.description: pinoytumblr: modifyyona: 1. Only in the Philippines will you see people ditching the comfort of sipping a cup of Starbucks coffee inside the airconditioned store and preferring instead to sit outside and be soaked dry by the heat of the tropical sun.

item.title: Deplurked
item.description: I’ve deplurked long enough I guess. Karma points are way, way down!

item.title: Feeling Bene Gesserit
item.description: I must not fear. Fear is the mind-killer. Fear is the little-death that brings total obliteration.

item.title: pink v.smile tv learning system for sale
item.description: My wife and I are selling one of Kysa’s barely-used toys. It’s one of Vtech’s multi-awarded preschool consoles and one of the best educational toys around.

item.title: LJ rocks more than ever
item.description: Thanks to eclair for the links. :) And I thought scribfire rawked totally. Whee!

item.title: Movin' on
item.description: Originally posted in my “other” blog. By the end of the month, I will be moving to the Queen City of the South, with my family in tow.

item.title: Meh
item.description: If I pointed you to another blog of mine, would you visit that as much, considering that it would have mostly techno babble in it, and that it won’t have the indispensable “my friends” link (because it’s not on LJ)?
